segments.text: Lifetime Achievement Award out here.
He, uh...
I have been on the road for the last five months.
I don't know, man.
I'm just really thinking the worst of people.
Really, yeah.
You see some of the animals.
Some of the animals I see.
Like, I was in the airport the other day, right?
I'm sitting there waiting for my flight.
Just hating my life.
Watching this lady, she's eating egg McMuffins.
Like, plural.
Right down her throat, like a pelican.
Just like, right down her belly.
And when she was done, she wiped her face with the back.
She just got a straight razor shave.
I saw this other dude, he was so out of shape,
he was, like, trying to itch his back
and he couldn't reach it.
So he walked up to a support pole
that was holding up an entire floor of the airport
and just walks up and he just starts, like,
rubbing up against it.
Like a grizzly bear.
Just sitting there.
Fucking animal.
Dude, I am so pro swine flu.
It's, like, ridiculous.
I want it.
We need a plague.
I'm telling you, we need a plague.
It's got to happen.
Don't be afraid.
It's only going to kill the weak.
Put on a sweater.
Take some vitamins.
You've got to be fine.
She keeps trying to help us out
and we won't let her do it.
She keeps trying to thin the hern
every single time, like,
oh, good day to get your vaccination.
Why? Why?
So Egg McMuffin Lady can breathe
with the back fat guy, you know?
It's got to happen.
You've got to let it do it.
Seriously, plague, it's like nature's forest fire, you know?
Just let it burn out
all the dead wood.
No, I swear to God,
we're the only species
that saves the weak.
We really are.
Lions don't do that shit, you know?
Lion gets a little thorn in his paw
and everybody's like, oh, it's having an intervention.
How are you feeling? Is everything all right?
You need some penicillin?
And it's like, fuck him.
That's why there's no traffic on the serengeti.
Not a bunch of lions
just standing there and gridlocking.
Like, what the fuck is going on up there?
Dude, go! Just fucking go!
Our lady, you get up there,
there's some hyena looking at his balls,
like, oh, that was a big hold up, right?
Like, you never saw that before.
Oh, by all means, slow down
and look at it.
So...
I got a girlfriend, man.
I watch a lot of TV with her, you know?
I just annoy the hell out of her.
She loves watching the Oprah Winfrey show
and I love, like, watching her
watch the Oprah Winfrey show.
And I wait for Oprah to say something stupid
and the second she does, I just take it out of my girl
because I'm an asshole.
No, that's what I do.
No, we were watching it the other day, you know,
Oprah's on there, she's interviewing some clam,
you know?
And, uh...
She's giving her this big, ridiculous intro.
Like, she's done this, she's done that,
she's done this, and she does
the most difficult job on the planet.
She's the mother and continues on immediately.
I just look at my girlfriend, like...
Like, really?
Being a mother
is the most difficult job on the planet.
Oh, yeah, all those mothers
who die every year from black lung,
from inhaling all that cold dust.
Dude, women
are just constantly
patting themselves on the back
about how difficult their lives are
and no one corrects them
because they want to fuck them.
So there's just this tornado
of, like, misinformation.
It's a difficult job on the planet.
What would you rather be doing?
Drilling to the center of the earth,
shaking hands with the devil.
Every time there's a rumble in the ground,
you wait for the whole thing to collapse
down on top of you
so they can write that folk song about you.
You know?
Would you rather be up in the sunshine
running around with a couple of toddlers
that you can send to bed anytime you want
or some sort of trumped-up charges?
Right?
And you can watch the prices, right?
You know what I mean?
I couldn't believe it.
It's the most difficult job on the planet.
Oh, yeah?
I thought roofing in the middle of July
is a redhead. I thought that that was difficult.
But these mothers
are bending over at the waist
putting DVDs into DVD players.
I don't know how they do it.
Any job that you can do in your pajamas
is not a difficult job.
All right?
One question. 35 years old
playing hide-and-go-seek.
You live in the dream.
You live in the dream.
No time card, no taxes.
You're off the fucking grid.
Thinkin' popsicle stick houses.
I mean, I would...
It's the most difficult job on the planet.
Oprah's not even a mother.
How the fuck would she know?
Unbelievable.
I ran it, neither am I,
but I, you know, think it kind of balances itself out.
I don't...
I'm so full of shit. I really...
I really realize that about myself.
I mean, that's one thing about gettin' old.
You just realize how full of shit you are.
You know, people ask you questions.
You just start answering them.
You know, you get to that point,
you're just watching the shit coming out of your mouth.
People sitting there listening, taking notes.
You know, it's like
I flunked everything in high school.
Why would you listen to me? You know?
I was having lunch with this girl the other day, right?
She looked across the table for me and she goes,
um, this is gonna seem oddly racist.
And I was like, all right, this is gonna be awesome.
41 years old.
Never heard a conversation started this way.
Let's have it, baby. Let's see what you got.
She's just like, um,
there are a lot of Asians in this restaurant.
I'm like, that's not racist.
That's an observation.
There are a lot of Asians in this restaurant.
However, if you were to say,
what the fuck are all these fucking Asians doing
in this goddamn restaurant?
Now, that would seem oddly racist.
But you still haven't said anything bad about Asians,
but you definitely seem to have a problem
with that being in the restaurant,
which is odd.
That's odd because I've never heard any bad stereotypes
about Asians in restaurants, you know what I mean?
Like, dude, they come in,
they're taking up all the tables, you know?
Just being all Asian.
But here, y'all here was about their driving, right?
And even that one's bullshit.
It's not that they suck, there's no happy medium.
You know?
See the Tokyo Drift, 90 miles an hour driving sideways,
parallel parking and breakdancing into the club.
You're like, Jesus Christ, is that guy from the future?
How does one man possess all of that talent?
Oh, they're just stopping in an intersection.
You know?
They don't even get mad, they don't even get mad.
They're like, I know, I suck, I don't know what it is.
It's boring, it's almost like it's so simple
I just start daydreaming and eh, you know.
I don't know.
I find a lot of that racial stuff fascinating,
you know, like the different rules
of like who gets in trouble, who doesn't.
Like I've noticed black people have the genius
to put the curse word after they say the race of the person.
We're white dudes, we always put it in front.
And if we would just make that little adjustment,
we could save so many careers,
so many jobs, could be saved in the white community
if we would just put it after.
You never noticed that in conversation with a black guy
being like, man, I was standing there
and this Asian motherfucker came in,
he starts talking about, you don't even hear it.
Hello, what did this Asian motherfucker do?
I would love to hear the rest of this story, right?
But I would tell the exact same story,
right? I'm standing there, right?
This fucking Asian comes in, right?
Everybody's like, whoa, whoa, hey, easy, easy, easy, dude.
What year is it, you know?
It's like, dude, I just said what he said.
I just preempted the fuck.
That's all I think.
He suggested he's hooking up with people's mothers.
I'm not even doing that.
I got it out of the way.
I got it out of the way.
It's just how I talk.
This fucking guy came in, this is fucking Asian.
Dude, are you wearing sandals?
Jesus Christ.
Oh, my God, sandals with...
middle of December.
Yeah, fucking, you one of those people.
Man, my feet don't get cold.
Man, I don't get cold.
You know, I always said one guy, big ski parker in shorts.
Man, my legs, my legs don't get cold.
Legs don't get cold.
That's like his only hope of hooking up with somebody.
Like, maybe that's interesting to mate with.
That'll make a strong baby.
His legs don't get cold. I don't know what it is.
Plenty of blood for the organs.
That had nothing to do with you.
That had to do with me being on the road for four months.
That's all it is.
I love this city, man.
This is one of my favorite cities to come out to, man.
I really do.
I do.
I like it.
You know what?
Now you've got enough weirdos here.
It's enough mom and pop sort of independent run stores.
That's a big thing with me.
Like, when I go on the road,
I don't see these chains anymore.
I just can't...

and see another hoard of fat people
stumbling out of a cheesecake factory?
You know?
Oh, they're horrific.
Just pressing their face up against the glass.
Man, they put cookies in that one.
It's like they're inventing
ways to get extra fat, you know?
You know what I hate about these corporate chains?
You go in there.
You're paying for a business.
They make you, like, do half the job now.
I don't get it.
Let me get a turkey sandwich, lettuce, tomato,
and rye with mayonnaise.
The guy behind the counter is like,
all right, turkey sandwich, lettuce, tomato, and rye.
Yeah, and mayonnaise.
Oh, the mayonnaise is right over there.
Really? Why don't you fucking go over there
and put it on my sandwich?
I'm on this side of the register.
Guy who orders the sandwich,
guy who fucking makes the sandwich.
You get it?
I'm not doing it.
I just gave you 100% of the money
to make 100% of the sandwich.
This isn't like a relay race.
You make half the sandwich,
then you hand it off to me.
I run over, I throw a pickle on it,
frisbee it over to my mom.
She sticks an olive with a toothpick in it.
Do you recognize me?
It's because I don't fucking work here, all right?
Make the sandwich.
I gave you the money. I'm out.
It's over. That's the end of my part.
No, I asked the guy for a drink.
He gave me a cup.
I finally go, you know what? Let me just get this whole thing to go.
And the guy's like, right, get your co-lids.
They're right over there. You just snap the lid on top.

Where is he?
I just choke my way up that corporate ladder
until I get to that eyes-wide shut party

I get the door open.
The second they see my angry face,
and that lid, I didn't have to explain myself.
Just put it over somebody's face
and it just starts...
a bitch you fucking yacht gotta be.

for the taping.

Cannot have a bottle cap.
Let me put that down there.
What if I slip and fell 17 minutes

Now it's not a special.

like, that's not enough for them.

hey, can we have your phone number?
No.

No, you can't have my phone number.

and I can't get to the next...

That's it.
That's a very exclusive neighborhood.

No. No, I know.
Would you like one?
No, I wouldn't.

a nickel off of, like, bootleg fruit loops.

Nah, it does. It's unreal.

one murder mystery after another,
you know, be on YouTube all night long.

I get, like, halfway down. I just start nodding off.

The balls of that.

you bring it up, you pay me, you put it in a bag,

You count five Mississippi.

you just play dumb.
I didn't know. I didn't know.

I don't work here.
I did my job.
I picked out what I wanted. I brought it up.

No.

I'm done with all of them.
I'm done with the phone.

nobody can help, but everybody understands.

I totally understand, and I'm sorry,

So they gradually...

suddenly make it your fault.

No.

I had an anger problem. It was on just, like,
little random things.

I was done ordering.

I got a...

up on that silver ladder,
just scooping shit out of the gutters.
My neighbor coming over.

thinking about what might have been.
